quest.name: Mummy Dearest
journal: The bashful air ill suits a Roegadyn but Ahldfoet has it nevertheless, wearing the sheepishness like an incommodious singlet.
Ahldfoet has promised a favor to a mother he met at a port of call, one whose entreaties seem to stir the poet in him. Take her letter to Wiltswys at Camp Skull Valley.
Expecting a heartwarming scene, you hand Wiltswys the letter from her mother. Alas, you are sent away with a flea in your ear instead. Ah, family matters.

dialogue.name: AHLDFOET
dialogue.text: Ahoy, Forename. It clean slipped my mind the last time, but I've another thing to ask of ye. My bearings are lively on the water, but on land─well, I'm what you landlubbers call at sea. Got a letter that needs delivering and you're the maidman for it.

dialogue.name: AHLDFOET
dialogue.text: I went ashore on some rock on the voyage in, and a faded petticoat comes up to me, says she got a daughter in Camp Skull Valley what she hadn't seen in years. Had tears in her eyes─pretty eyes too, for a woman past her childin' years. She must've been a real beauty in her day.

dialogue.name: AHLDFOET
dialogue.text: Always had a soft spot for tawny eyes...mayhap because the sea is a green-eyed virago and the skies, her sisters, have eyes blue and red, grey and black... Well, this daughter of hers goes by Wiltswys. You'll take the letter to her?

dialogue.name: WILTSWYS
dialogue.text: Greetings, adventurer. They said you were looking for me?

dialogue.name: WILTSWYS
dialogue.text: A letter from Mama! I haven't heard from her in so long... She never answered my letters. No, stay, for I'll have a reply to send!

dialogue.name: WILTSWYS
dialogue.text: What the...! Oh, the stone-hearted, grasping hag! Wouldn't let me take so much as a hunk of dried fish when I left the island, and now she wants gil? That...that succubus!

dialogue.name: WILTSWYS
dialogue.text: You think me cold? Well, fie on what you think! I wanted something better than tilling salty fields and spilling small fry out the nets, and occasionally taking a passing sailor into my bed for more o' the same! She'll receive no reply from me. Thank you for your service, and good eveningday to you!

obj.n: On a Wing and a Prayer
